hub.name: Florence
hub.description: The capital of the renowned Tuscany region and a real cradle of the Renaissance, irresistible Florence is among the most well-packed Italian cities in terms of extraordinary art masterpieces. Being the hometown of such prominent Italian writers like Dante Alighieri and Francesco Petrarca, Florence still inspires creators and artists from around the world. The true icon which defines the city is the magnificent Cathedral of Santa Maria del Fiore, hiding some exciting secrets you would definitely like to reveal. Speaking of more outstanding Florence attractions, make sure to save time for the brilliant Florence museums like the home of Michelangelo

Accademia, the Uffizi Gallery, and the Leonardo da Vinci Museum, each boasting just jaw-dropping art collections. Walking around Florence, you can still feel the spirit of such great art geniuses as Brunelleschi, da Vinci and Michelangelo harmoniously combined with the atmosphere of a vibrant modern city with plenty of entertainment opportunities. Already packing your bags?
hub.preview: The capital of the renowned Tuscany region and a real cradle of the Renaissance, irresistible Florence is among the most well-packed Italian cities in terms of extraordinary art masterpieces.

hotel.name: Hotel De La Ville
hotel.preview: Situated on the pedestrian street of Via Tornabuoni, the magnificent 4-star Hotel De La Ville, is a wonderful choice for everyone staying in the Italian gem of Florence.
hotel.addressForMap: IT, Piazza degli Antinori, 1/r, Florence, 50123 Hotel De La Ville
hotel.description: Centrally located on a pedestrian high-fashion street of Via Tornabuoni, this 4-star hotel is within a walking distance of the Florence Cathedral and the Uffizi Gallery.

activity.name: Half Day Comprehensive Guided Walking Tour
activity.description: After breakfast at your hotel, meet with your private guide and go on a comprehensive walking tour of Florence

s program includes exploration of the Piazza del Duomo with a visit to the Baptistery dedicated to St. John the Baptist.

Your ticket to the Grande Museo del Duomo allows you to visit the other magnificent monuments of Piazza del Duomo in your free time within 72 hours: the Cathedral itself, the famous Dome, the Bell Tower, and the Cathedral Museum with works by Michelangelo and Donatello.

As you proceed to the main square of the city - Piazza della Signoria - you pass through the heart of the historical center with its landmark sites like Piazza della Repubblica and the Strozzi Palace. Stroll down via Tornabuoni, one of the most beautiful streets of the city, famous for its fine shops. 

We will also cross over the Arno River on the Ponte Vecchio to enter the Oltrarno district where you see numerous local craftsmen shops and the beautiful Santo Spirito Church and Convent, built for the Augustinians. In this very part of the city you can find an early work of Michelangelo dating back to when he was just 17 years old. 

During the tour we also visit the Galleria dell

s famous colossal statue of David, a must-see in Florence. 

After the tour return to your hotel and enjoy an evening at your own leisure.
activity.experienceDescription: Embark on an Italian adventure and enjoy Florence sightseeing with a professional English-speaking guide. Some of the highlights of the walking tour include Piazza della Signoria, Strozzi Palace and the famous statue of David by Michelangelo at Galleria dell'Accademia.

notes.dayByDay:
Day 1: Arrival in Florence
Welcome to Florence! Upon arrival, your private driver transfers you to the hotel for check-in. The rest of the day is at your own leisure to relax after the trip.

Day 2: Florence Sightseeing\xc2\xa0
After breakfast at your hotel, meet with your private guide and go on a comprehensive walking tour of Florence's highlights.

Today's program includes exploration of the Piazza del Duomo with a visit to the Baptistery dedicated to St. John the Baptist.

Your ticket to the Grande Museo del Duomo allows you to visit the other magnificent monuments of Piazza del Duomo in your free time within 72 hours: the Cathedral itself, the famous Dome, the Bell Tower, and the Cathedral Museum with works by Michelangelo and Donatello.

As you proceed to the main square of the city - Piazza della Signoria - you pass through the heart of the historical center with its landmark sites like Piazza della Repubblica and the Strozzi Palace. Stroll down via Tornabuoni, one of the most beautiful streets of the city, famous for its fine shops.

We will also cross over the Arno River on the Ponte Vecchio to enter the Oltrarno district where you see numerous local craftsmen shops and the beautiful Santo Spirito Church and Convent, built for the Augustinians. In this very part of the city you can find an early work of Michelangelo dating back to when he was just 17 years old.

During the tour we also visit the Galleria dell'Accademia to see Michelangelo's famous colossal statue of David, a must-see in Florence.

After the tour return to your hotel and enjoy an evening at your own leisure.

Day 3: Day at Leisure\xc2\xa0in Florence\xc2\xa0
Today is reserved for you to explore and enjoy Florence on your own. After breakfast you can do some independent sightseeing, shop for souvenirs or have a good rest. We suggest visiting the Uffizi Gallery, the Pitti Palace or joining one of our carefully planned optional tours.

Day 4: Departure
Following breakfast in your hotel, you check out and meet your private driver for the transfer.

hub.name: Delhi
hub.description:
Delhi is India's capital and a major gateway to the country. It is a bustling metropolis, which successfully combines in its fold the ancient and the modern. Its strategic location was one of the prime reasons why successive dynasties chose it as their seat of power. It is not surprising then that what constitutes Delhi today is a conglomerate of seven cities. 

The throbbing present of Delhi pulls one out of reflections on a mute past. The divisions in the walled city and New Delhi also mark the varied lifestyles. With a history that goes back many centuries, It showcases an ancient culture and a rapidly modernising country. Dotted with monuments there is much to discover here. The seat of many powerful empires in the past, its long history can be traced in its many carefully-preserved monuments, ancient forts and tombs.
All this is combined with the best features of a modern city such as a metro system, bustling markets and fabulous eating places. The past and the present meld seamlessly together, making centuries-old monuments a part of the city\xe2\x80\x99s daily life. Delhi is very much a history\xe2\x80\x99s child.

hotel.name: Haveli Dharampura
hotel.description: Spacious accommodations, friendly service and a paradise-like setting await you at Dharampura Haveli. Set in the heart of Delhi, the dreamily beautiful historic Dharampura Haveli nestles amongst the narrow alleys of Chandni Chowk. Giving you a feeling of a vintage memory lane, the 5\xe2\x80\x99 alley with residences and small shops on both sides, creates a cosy and \xe2\x80\x9caway-from-it-all\xe2\x80\x9d atmosphere, leading you to the Haveli. The Haveli dates back to 1887 AD and its stunning design reflects the rich cultural heritage of the Mughal period. The Haveli bears a distinctive style of the late Mughal architecture and is featured in the INTACH listing, an organization aimed at preserving and restoring the important historical buildings in India. Dharampura Haveli has been restored by Rajya Sabha MP, Mr Vijay Goel along with Heritage India, using traditional style of construction for preservation of antiquity and aesthetics.

activity.name: Half Day New Delhi City Tour
activity.description:
Start your day with a convenient hotel pick up. Your guide and driver will await you downstairs in the lobby and after a short meet and greet, you"ll set-off to your first destination - the Lotus Temple, or, Bahai"s House of Worship. Notable for its flowerlike shape, marvel at one of the city"s most stunning attractions. Like all Bah\xc3\xa1"\xc3\xad houses of worship, the Lotus Temple is open to all, regardless of race or religion.

Next, drive to the Gurudwara Bangla Sahib, a must-see Sikh temple. Gurudwara Bangla Sahib is one of the most prominent Sikh gurdwara, (Sikh houses of worship) in Delhi. The temple is known for its association with the eighth Sikh Guru, Guru Har Krishan, as well as the pool inside its complex, known as the

, truly a sight to behold. Whilst here, you"ll also get to visit the community kitchen serving food to thousands of people daily. Continue on your drive and admire more landmarks of historical and cultural significance such as the Agrasen ki Baoli, The India Gate, the President"s House, and Humayun"s Tomb, the tomb of the Mughal Emperor. Visiting all these attractions will surely raise your appetite, luckily, you"ll also get to stop for lunch and enjoy some of the local delicacies. 

At the end of your tour, you"ll be transported back to your accommodation.

activity.name: Taj Mahal and Agra Fort Sunrise Tour
activity.description:
Enjoy a full-day visit to Agra from Delhi starting very early in the morning in order to arrive at the Taj Mahal by sunrise. Begin your journey with a hotel pick-up at 03:00 in a private air-conditioned cab. Enjoy the spectacular Taj Mahal from outside before looking inside the temple to Mumtaj Mahal, wife of the Mugal Emperor Shah Jahan. 

Later, continue to the nearby Red Fort (Agra Fort) to see the beautiful pavilions of a walled city.

Post visit to the Red Fort, enjoy your breakfast at a nearby local restaurant. Next, depart for New Delhi and get dropped off back at your hotel.

notes.dayByDay:
Day 1: Arrival and Day at Leisure

Upon arrival, your driver meets you at the airport and takes you to your centrally located hotel for check-in. The rest of the day is at your leisure.


Day 2: Taj Mahal and Agra Fort Sunrise Tour

Enjoy a full-day visit to Agra from Delhi starting very early in the morning in order to arrive at the Taj Mahal by sunrise.


Begin your journey with a hotel pick-up at 03:00 in a private air-conditioned cab. Enjoy the spectacular Taj Mahal from outside before looking inside the temple to Mumtaj Mahal, wife of the Mugal Emperor Shah Jahan.


Later, continue to the nearby Red Fort (Agra Fort) to see the beautiful pavilions of a walled city.


Post your visit to the Red Fort, enjoy your breakfast at a nearby local restaurant. Next, depart for New Delhi and get dropped off back at your hotel.


Day 3: Half Day New Delhi City Tour

Following breakfast, your guide and driver will meet you and you"ll set-off to your first destination - the Lotus Temple, or, Bahai"s House of Worship. Notable for its flowerlike shape, marvel at one of the city"s most stunning attractions. Like all Bah\xc3\xa1"\xc3\xad houses of worship, the Lotus Temple is open to all, regardless of race or religion.


Next, drive to the Gurudwara Bangla Sahib, a must-see Sikh temple. Gurudwara Bangla Sahib is one of the most prominent Sikh gurdwara, (Sikh houses of worship) in Delhi. The temple is known for its association with the eighth Sikh Guru, Guru Har Krishan, as well as the pool inside its complex, known as the

, truly a sight to behold. Whilst here, you"ll also get to visit the community kitchen serving food to thousands of people daily. Continue on your drive and admire more landmarks of historical and cultural significance such as the Agrasen ki Baoli, The India Gate, the President"s House, and Humayun"s Tomb, the tomb of the Mughal Emperor. Visiting all these attractions will surely raise your appetite, luckily, you"ll also get to stop for lunch and enjoy some of the local delicacies. 


At the end of your tour, you"ll be transported back to your hotel.


Day 4: Departure

Following breakfast, you check out from the hotel and depart from Delhi.
